sen.j: 良円（りょうえん、永観元年（983年） - 永承5年（1050年）7月 (旧暦)）は、平安時代中期の天台宗僧侶。
sen.e: Ryoen (who was born in 983 and died in the seventh month of 1050 under the old lunar calendar), was a mid-Heian period Buddhist monk of the Tendai sect.
Ryoen (who was born in 983 and died in the seventh month of 1050 under the old lunar calendar), was a mid-Heian period Buddhist monk of the Tendai sect.
Ryoen (983 - July 1050) was a Buddhist priest of the Tendai sect during the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 右大臣藤原実資の庶子。
sen.e: He was the illegitimate son of the Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Sanesuke.
He was the illegitimate son of the Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Sanesuke.

sen.j: 母親については、宮仕えをしていた女性であると『大鏡』に載せられており、藤原朝成の縁者とする説もあるが不詳。
sen.e: Concerning his mother, the "Okagami" records that she was one of the ladies engaged in court service, while another theory holds that she was a relative of FUJIWARA no Tomonari, but nothing is known for certain.

sen.cmt: 大鏡 の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 母親の出自によるものか、小野宮家の後継者とはみなされておらず、永祚 (日本)元年（989年）に7歳にして延暦寺の慶円 (天台宗)（実資の母方伯父）の元に預けられた。
sen.e: Perhaps because of his mother's low birth, he was not chosen to be the successor to the Onomiya house, so in 989, at the age of seven, he was entrusted to the care of the Tendai-sect monk Kyoen of Enryaku-ji temple (who was also Sanesuke's maternal uncle).

sen.j: その後、出家して内供に補される。
sen.e: Thereafter, he took the tonsure (i.e., became a monk) and was appointed a naigu (low-ranking monk serving at court).

sen.j: 長和4年（1015年）、大僧正となっていた慶円は自分の辞任と引き換えに良円の律師就任を申請したが、慶円と不仲であった藤原道長が反対したため実現しなかった。
sen.e: In 1015, Kyoen, now a daisojo (high priest), submitted a recommendation on the occasion of his own retirement that Ryoen be appointed a risshi (a priestly rank), but because Kyoen was not on good terms with the powerful FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Michinaga opposed this move and thus it did not happen.

In 1015, Keien, now a Daisojo (a priest of the highest rank in the highest managerial position), submitted a recommendation on the occasion of his own retirement that Ryoen be appointed a Risshi (the third rank of priest following Sojo and Sozu), but because Keien was not on good terms with the powerful FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Michinaga opposed this move and thus it did not happen.
sen.cmt: Keien としました。大僧正、律師 の補足を変更しました。

sen.j: 4年後に同様の申請を行って藤原頼通の許可を得るが、またも道長の反対によりまたも見送られた。
sen.e: When the same request was resubmitted four years later they did obtain FUJIWARA no Yorimichi's permission, but because Michinaga was still against it, once again Ryoen could not secure a promotion.

sen.j: 寛仁3年12月9日 (旧暦)（1020年1月6日）作成された実資の処分状にて良円の異母妹藤原千古に財産を継承させるために「道俗子等一切不可口入」を宣言しているが、この「道俗」とは良円（＝道）と養嗣子藤原資平（＝俗）のことと考えられている。
sen.e: In the missive detailing Sanesuke's punishment drafted on January 6, 1020, the following statement was included, in an attempt to make FUJIWARA no Chiko, Ryoen's sister by another mother, his heir: "Children who are monks and laymen shall in no case be able to take his place," and this "monks and laymen" is thought to refer to Ryoen (the monk) and Sanesuke's adopted heir, FUJIWARA no Sukehira (the layman).

In the missive detailing Sanesuke's punishment drafted on January 12, 1020, the following statement was included, in an attempt to make FUJIWARA no Chiko, Ryoen's paternal younger half-sister, his heir: 'Children who are priests and laymen shall in no case be able to take his place,' and this 'priests and laymen' is thought to refer to Ryoen (the priest) and Sanesuke's adopted heir, FUJIWARA no Sukehira (the layman).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。異母妹 の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 道長没後の長元元年（1028年）に漸く権律師となり、翌年法性寺東北院別当となる。
sen.e: In 1028, after Michinaga died, Ryoen at last became a gon risshi (a middle rank in the priesthood), and the following year became the abbot of Tohoku-in subtemple at Hosho-ji temple.
In 1028, after Michinaga died, Ryoen at last became a gon risshi (a middle rank in the priesthood), and the following year became the abbot of Tohoku-in subtemple at Hosho-ji temple.

In 1028, after Michinaga died, Ryoen at last became a Gon no Risshi (a provisional rank in the lowest managerial position), and the following year became betto (chief priest) of Tohoku-in subtemple at Hosho-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 権律師、別当 の補足を修正しました。

sen.j: 更に長元6年（1033年）には権少僧都に任ぜられた。
sen.e: And then, in 1033, he was appointed a Gon shosozu (lesser junior prelate).

sen.cmt: 権少僧都 補足を変更しました。

sen.j: ところが、長暦2年（1038年）、天台座主に園城寺明尊が任ぜられたことから勃発した「山相論」において、頼通から延暦寺大衆 (仏教)の説得を期待された良円は説得に失敗したのみならず、翌年には彼らに擁されて頼通の高倉殿に大衆3千人と強訴する事件を引き起こして罪に問われる。
sen.e: Yet in 1038, once Myoson of Onjo-ji temple became the Zasu (High Priest) of the entire Tendai sect, the "sansoron" (the mountain debate) broke out; Ryoen, in whose persuasive power Yorimichi had the highest expectations of any in the clergy at Enryaku-ji temple, was defeated in the debate, and what's worse, the following year he was blamed for gathering the clergy around him and inciting a crowd of 3000 monks to march on Yorimichi's Takakura palace and stage a goso (forceful protest).

Yet in 1038, once Myoson of Onjo-ji Temple became the Tendai-zasu (the highest post of Tendai sect), the "sansoron" (the mountain debate) broke out; Ryoen, who was expected by Yorimichi to persuade the priests residing in Enryaku-ji Temple, was defeated in the debate, and what's worse, the following year he was blamed for gathering the clergy around him and inciting a crowd of 3000 priests to march on Yorimichi's Takakura palace and stage a goso (forceful protest).
sen.cmt: 天台座主 を追加しました。

sen.j: これによって、事実上失脚して権少僧都のまま病没した。
sen.e: Due to these setbacks, he actually ended up losing his power and influence, and was still stuck at the rank of gon shosozu (lesser junior prelate) when he died.
